awd_titl_txt: Study of Rapid Prototyping Facilities in the United States  Manufacturing Research Community
awd_abstract_narration: This award is to explore the feasibility, areas of                         application, and strategies for implementing rapid prototyping                  facilities in U.S. manufacturing research communities.  The                     work will be guided by a committee selected by the                              Manufacturing Studies Board, and will be comprised of experts                   in machined parts fabrication, advanced materials development                   and application, computer-integrated design and manufacturing,                  and small machine shop operations.  Co-supporters of this                       effort are Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA)                    and the National Bureau of Standards.  The anticipated result                   of this work is a report describing possible strategies to                      implement the rapid prototyping facilities concept.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation
